subject: Re: [junit] JUnit not matching to my needs - execute order sh ows design flaw ?
msgSnippet: ... ....then write one test called testDatabaseConnection() . If that fails, then the rest is self-evident. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Andrew Forward wrote:

> Yes.
>
> But all database tests will fail, without any one test pin-pointing
> the why. I would prefer to see one problem (in this case invalid
> database connection) be isolated by one failing test (additional tests
> may fail - but more because of the side effect of this one test).

....then write one test called "testDatabaseConnection()". If that
fails, then the rest is self-evident.
